description:
This is the Contract W2 opportunity with Amazee Global Ventures Inc.
The Job Description given below is a Lead/ Architect level position.
We welcome all qualified applicants for this Contract W2 role.
Job Title: Data Scientist
Job Type: Contract W2
Job Mode: On-site
Location: Salt Lake City, UT
Duration: 12+ Months (Long Term Possible)
Pay Rate: $60 on Contact W2
Position Overview: We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with 15+ years of experience to lead advanced data science initiatives, from developing complex machine learning models to strategic analytics solutions. This role requires a professional with deep technical expertise, proven leadership skills, and a history of transforming data into actionable insights that drive business success.
Key Responsibilities:

 Data Strategy & Leadership: Define and execute a comprehensive data strategy that aligns data science initiatives with key business goals.
 Advanced Analytics & Modeling: Design and deploy predictive and prescriptive models, leveraging machine learning and AI to solve complex business problems.
 Big Data Management: Oversee the architecture, optimization, and management of large-scale data systems to ensure efficient processing and storage.
 Database Solutions: Build and maintain robust data storage and retrieval solutions that ensure accuracy, compliance, and security.
 Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Finance to develop data-driven solutions that address critical business needs.
 Team Leadership & Mentorship: Lead and mentor data science team members, promoting skill development and a collaborative environment.
 Stakeholder Communication: Translate complex analytical insights into actionable recommendations, tailoring communication to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 Data Governance & Quality: Implement best practices for data quality, privacy, and compliance to maintain data integrity and regulatory adherence.
 Innovation & Trend Exploration: Keep abreast of the latest trends, tools, and methodologies in data science, championing new ideas to enhance our competitive edge.

Experience, Skills, and Qualifications:

 Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field (Master’s or Ph.D. preferred).
 Experience: 15+ years in data science, analytics, or related fields with demonstrated success in managing data science projects across various industries.
 Technical Proficiency:
 Programming Languages: Expert in Python, R, and SQL.
 Machine Learning & AI: Advanced knowledge in machine learning libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch), statistical analysis, and deep learning algorithms.
 Big Data Tools: Proficient in big data tools (Hadoop, Spark) and cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP).
 Data Engineering: Skilled in ETL processes, data pipeline creation, and database management.
 Data Visualization: Proficiency with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
 Leadership & Communication: Proven ability to lead teams and excellent communication skills for conveying complex data insights to a wide audience.
 Problem-Solving: Analytical and detail-oriented, with the ability to balance multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.

Amazee Global Ventures Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer. We will not discriminate and will follow all measures to ensure no discrimination in employment, recruitment, advertisements for employment, compensation, termination, upgrading, promotions, and other conditions of employment against any employee or job applicant based on race, colour, gender, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all staff members, clients, volunteers, subcontractors, vendors, and clients.
Thanks and Regards
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Pay: $55.00 - $60.00 per hour
Experience:

 overall: 10 years (Required)

Work Location: On the road

description:
Innovate with purpose
  
  At BILL, we believe in empowering the businesses that drive our economy. By replacing outdated financial processes with innovative tools, we help businesses—from startups to established brands—make smarter decisions and gain control of their operations. And we don’t stop there: we’re creating the future of financial automation so businesses can spend more time on what matters.
  
  Working here means you become part of a vision-driven team that’s ready to tackle challenges and build cutting-edge solutions. We value purpose, drive, and curiosity—and we thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. Whether in one of our offices in San Jose, CA, Draper, UT, or working remotely, BILLders collaborate to deliver real impact for businesses that need more time in their busy weeks.
  
  At BILL, we listen, learn, and lead—fostering collaboration and a drive for continuous growth. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace that values each person’s unique skills and experiences. Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we’d love to hear from you—you might be just what we’re looking for, whether in this role or another.
  
  ✨ Let’s give businesses more time for what matters.
 
 Our Beliefs:
 
  Data reveals hidden truths that enable better investments.
  Our products are stronger when our roadmaps are data-informed.
  Great data science and analytics thought partners help product teams be more strategic and successful.
 
 Make your impact within a rapidly growing Fintech Company
 We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team. This role is a strategic and integral part of our company, supporting the core product platform and partnering with others on the team to unlock value through solutions modeling. This new role will give you the chance to own an end-to-end predictive human-in-the-loop solution directly used by Sales and Revenue teams.
 
  Advanced Degree or Proven Experience: Master’s in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. Or in lieu of degree, minimum of 2 years of experience in a data science role, with a track record of delivering high-impact projects into production.
  Technical Expertise: Strong background in statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and programming languages such as Python or R in a cloud-based environment.
  Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to analyze complex business problems and develop data-driven solutions that actually influence the end-user’s workflow.
  Communication Skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  Collaborative Mindset: Experience working in cross-functional teams and partnering with other departments to drive business outcomes.
 
 We’d love to chat if you have:
 
  Model Development: Design, develop, and implement predictive models, machine learning algorithms, and statistical analyses to solve complex business problems and extract actionable insights. Think attrition, card decline, potential to spend, etc.
  Data Analysis: Analyze high volume, complex transaction activity to assess patterns and trends for card declines and correlate with other customer outcomes.
  Cross-Functional Collaboration: Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders to define the business problem, its scope and then present findings and recommendations to a multi-level audience.
  Innovation: Stay updated with the latest developments in data science and machine learning, and apply them to improve existing processes and methodologies.
  Opportunity Identification: Enrich our evolving data stack via contributing to data features/models via dbt or other means.
 
 
  
   
    The estimated base salary range for this role is noted below for our office location in Draper, UT. Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in BILL’s bonus and equity plan. Our ranges for each role and job level are based on a variety of factors including candidate experience, expertise, and geographic location and may vary from the amounts listed above. The role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, 401(k) retirement plan, flexible spending & health savings account, paid holidays, paid time off, and other company benefits.
   
   
    Draper UT pay range
   
   
    $99,500—$119,300 USD
   
  
 
 
  What’s in it for you?
  Redefining how businesses automate their work is a fast-paced, exciting, and fun environment. But we also have benefits and perks to ensure the magic isn’t only experienced by our customers, but by our employees as well.
  Here is a preview of some of the amazing benefits here at BILL:  
  
   100% paid employee health, dental, and vision plans (choose HMO, PPO, or HDHP)
   HSA & FSA accounts
   Life Insurance, Long & Short-term disability coverage
   Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
   11+ Observed holidays and wellness days and flexible time off
   Employee Stock Purchase Program with employee discounts
   Wellness & Fitness initiatives
   Employee recognition and referral programs
   And much more
  
  Don’t believe us? Check out our culture, benefits, and teams on our career site, LinkedIn Life, or YouTube pages.
  BILL is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values diversity and inclusion. We believe our best ideas come from the unique stories, perspectives, and experiences of our team members. We welcome people of all backgrounds, abilities, and identities to bring their authentic selves and contribute to our culture.
  We are committed to a transparent, inclusive hiring process that reflects our values. If you need accommodations at any stage, please contact interviewaccommodations@hq.bill.com.
descriptionHTML:
Innovate with purpose


At BILL, we believe in empowering the businesses that drive our economy. By replacing outdated financial processes with innovative tools, we help businesses—from startups to established brands—make smarter decisions and gain control of their operations. And we don’t stop there: we’re creating the future of financial automation so businesses can spend more time on what matters.


Working here means you become part of a vision-driven team that’s ready to tackle challenges and build cutting-edge solutions. We value purpose, drive, and curiosity—and we thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. Whether in one of our offices in San Jose, CA, Draper, UT, or working remotely, BILLders collaborate to deliver real impact for businesses that need more time in their busy weeks.


At BILL, we listen, learn, and lead—fostering collaboration and a drive for continuous growth. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace that values each person’s unique skills and experiences. Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we’d love to hear from you—you might be just what we’re looking for, whether in this role or another.


✨ Let’s give businesses more time for what matters.

Our Beliefs:

  • Data reveals hidden truths that enable better investments.
  • Our products are stronger when our roadmaps are data-informed.
  • Great data science and analytics thought partners help product teams be more strategic and successful.

Make your impact within a rapidly growing Fintech Company

We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team. This role is a strategic and integral part of our company, supporting the core product platform and partnering with others on the team to unlock value through solutions modeling. This new role will give you the chance to own an end-to-end predictive human-in-the-loop solution directly used by Sales and Revenue teams.

  • Advanced Degree or Proven Experience: Master’s in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. Or in lieu of degree, minimum of 2 years of experience in a data science role, with a track record of delivering high-impact projects into production.

  • Communication Skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Collaborative Mindset: Experience working in cross-functional teams and partnering with other departments to drive business outcomes.

We’d love to chat if you have:

  • Model Development: Design, develop, and implement predictive models, machine learning algorithms, and statistical analyses to solve complex business problems and extract actionable insights. Think attrition, card decline, potential to spend, etc.
  • Data Analysis: Analyze high volume, complex transaction activity to assess patterns and trends for card declines and correlate with other customer outcomes.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders to define the business problem, its scope and then present findings and recommendations to a multi-level audience.
  • Innovation: Stay updated with the latest developments in data science and machine learning, and apply them to improve existing processes and methodologies.
  • Opportunity Identification: Enrich our evolving data stack via contributing to data features/models via dbt or other means.

The estimated base salary range for this role is noted below for our office location in Draper, UT. Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in BILL’s bonus and equity plan. Our ranges for each role and job level are based on a variety of factors including candidate experience, expertise, and geographic location and may vary from the amounts listed above. The role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, 401(k) retirement plan, flexible spending & health savings account, paid holidays, paid time off, and other company benefits.

Draper UT pay range
$99,500—$119,300 USD

What’s in it for you?

Redefining how businesses automate their work is a fast-paced, exciting, and fun environment. But we also have benefits and perks to ensure the magic isn’t only experienced by our customers, but by our employees as well.

Here is a preview of some of the amazing benefits here at BILL:


  • 100% paid employee health, dental, and vision plans (choose HMO, PPO, or HDHP)
  • HSA & FSA accounts
  • Life Insurance, Long & Short-term disability coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • 11+ Observed holidays and wellness days and flexible time off
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program with employee discounts
  • Wellness & Fitness initiatives
  • Employee recognition and referral programs
  • And much more

Don’t believe us? Check out our culture, benefits, and teams on our career site, LinkedIn Life, or YouTube pages.

BILL is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values diversity and inclusion. We believe our best ideas come from the unique stories, perspectives, and experiences of our team members. We welcome people of all backgrounds, abilities, and identities to bring their authentic selves and contribute to our culture.

We are committed to a transparent, inclusive hiring process that reflects our values. If you need accommodations at any stage, please contact interviewaccommodations@hq.bill.com.

description:
Are you looking for a friendly, fast-paced workplace with an emphasis on helping customers and empowering team members? Snap Finance is a thriving leader in the financial services industry, and our team members are the foundation of our success. Snap knows that happy, empowered, and engaged team members are essential to innovation and business success- and our approach is working. Come join us!
 
 Job Description 
 We are looking for a staff level machine learning engineer to join our machine learning team. The ideal person will have significant industry experience working on a range of classification and optimization problems. This person will take their expertise and apply it to exciting and diverse multimodal data with some of the most interesting and challenging inference problems in machine learning. They will be able to define new frameworks, tools, or processes that improve the overall engineering productivity and quality. Position would include model development and deployment and compiling/analyzing data from multiple sources with the objective of improving predictions to reduce risk, empower consumers and broaden our influence in a rapidly growing market of alternative finance.
 Key Responsibilities: 
 
  Develop and innovate on state-of-the-art, scalable models and tools leveraging artificial intelligence, machine learning, optimization, and rules-based models.
  Push the boundaries of what’s possible for assessing creditworthiness optimizing risk and analyzing customer behavior
  Propose, gather and integrate data and create valuable features
  Code projects in parallel with the data engineering team
  Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional and non-functional business requirements
 
 Qualifications: 
 
  MS or PhD in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or related quantitative field.
  Possess broad and deep technical expertise across multiple areas of machine learning. They often
  History of tackling challenging technical problems and involvement in making high-level decisions about technology choices and system architecture.
  BS in the fields described above will be considered if skill set and experience are robust
  7+ years experience in one or more of the following areas: machine learning, artificial intelligence, recommendation systems, data mining, or related research
 
 Skills, Experience & Qualifications Required 
 
 
  Strong background in Python, Java , or other general-purpose programming languages
  Extensive experience with deep learning and traditional classification methods (e.g. Neural Networks, Gradient Boosting, Decision Trees, Random Forest)
  Proficiency and working knowledge of at least one major deep learning framework (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow)
  Experience with filesystems, server architectures, and distributed systems
  Sequence modeling (e.g.RNNs, Natural Language Processing techniques, Attention-Based Autoregressive models)
  Statistical analysis (e.g., Hypothesis testing, experimental design, hierarchical modeling, Bayesian and Frequentist methods)
  Experience with automated workflows: Airflow, Jenkins, etc.
  Experience with AWS cloud services such as EC2 and S3
  Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable data store
  Familiarity with common computing environment (e.g. Linux, Shell Scripting)
  Strong SQL skills
  Proven ability to translate insights into business recommendations
 
 Personal Characteristics: 
 
  Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  Excellent communication skills with the ability to clearly explain technical topics to a non-technical audience
  Team-oriented but able to complete tasks independently at a high standard
  Structured, organized and detail-oriented
  Proactive, enthusiastic and flexible
  Fluency in English, both in oral and written form
  Ability to take projects from conceptualization to implementation
  Must be able to work onsite in our Salt Lake City office and be legal to work in the United States
 
 
 More… 
 Snap values diversity and all qualified applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Learn more by visiting our website at www.snapfinance.com .
 
 California Residents, please review our California Consumer Privacy Act Notice at https://snapfinance.com/ccpa-notice

description:
Data Scientist
 
  Why work at BYU?
 As the flagship higher education institution of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, Brigham Young University (BYU) strives to be among the exceptional universities in the world. At BYU, we are devoted to our faith and to our students. We take an active role in the university's mission: "To assist individuals in their quest for perfection and eternal life."
 Our unique mission, deeply rooted in the Gospel of Jesus Christ, provides countless ways to serve and make an impact. This, along with our remarkable culture of belonging, weekly devotionals, and endless opportunities for learning and growth - all situated within a beautiful and historic campus - make it hard to imagine a more inspiring place to work.
 
  Job Summary
 BYUtv | BYUradio is looking for a Data Scientist to help us grow our audiences and extend our reach through data-driven decision making. (Check out our world-class content at byutv.org and byuradio.org.)
 You will work in a positive, collaborative environment with others who are driven to create amazing work. You will receive many tangible and intangible benefits: Medical, Dental, Life, Long-term Disability, OAD&D, and retirement. For more information, please go to the Benefits website at: https://hrs.byu.edu/employee-benefits Other benefits include tuition, Employee Assistance Program, campus discounts and UTA pass (see website for specifics).
 Our Data Scientist will work closely with senior leadership and other stakeholders to create actionable plans for our organization. The Data Scientist will gather, analyze, and manipulate large sets of structured and unstructured data using computer science, statistics, and mathematics (potentially even software engineering) to interpret and then present the results to leadership.
 This position is an analytical expert that utilizes skills in both technology and social science to find trends, manage, and predict data. Data will come from a wide variety of sources and will largely be unstructured. This position will work to not only structure the data, but interpret and predict the data to provide clear business solutions and predictions on how the data is moving in efforts to help BYU Broadcasting executives, other campus (e.g. Athletics & Alumni Relations), non-campus, and Church partners and leaders to set clear business strategies for current and future programming.
 It is imperative this position have a strong knowledge of business operations, the ability to ingest data, analyze the data and present user-friendly analysis.
 
  Data & Software Development & Preparation
 
  Software Engineering / Development
   
    Use software development skills to import data from multiple sources into a data warehouse or data lake and other reporting systems for machine learning and human analysis
    Develops and codes software programs, develops, and enhances complex algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate, and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources
    Develops and maintains infrastructure systems that connect internal data sets
    Creates data mining architectures/models/protocols or other data collection frameworks for structured and unstructured ¿big data¿, statistical reporting, and data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets and to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and program enhancement
   
  Finds and identifies relevant data sets and sources including Nielsen, Adobe Analytics, Salesforce, etc. that measures performance across viewing audience and audience engagement
   
    Interacts with production teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments.
    Conducts research and explorative analyses to uncover potentially useful data trends which will provide strategic insight into business solutions and with the goal of breaking new ground in data analytics
    Provides business insights measured against key performance indicators
    Evaluates and identifies trends in BYUB audience engagement
    Assesses audience response to Salesforce-driven marketing campaigns
    Analyzes the effectiveness of promotional activities across social, digital ad placement, TV and Radio platforms (Google, Facebook, etc.)
   
 
  Data Analysis
 
  Applies and integrates statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling and business analysis skills to manage and manipulate complex high-volume data from a variety of sources in order to analyze how BYUtv and BYUradio compare against broader media consumption and audience engagement trends
  Summarizes business, operations, customer, and economic data in order to develop business intelligence, optimize effectiveness, and predict business outcomes:
   
    Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns and prepares ongoing reports and data visualizations (e.g., charts, dashboards, heat maps) in order to inform and guide business decisions made by BYU Broadcasting Executives and stakeholders
    Analyzes data to help predict business changes in response to micro-economics forces (i.e. cord-cutting, streaming services, viewing habits, etc.)
   
  Identifies and documents enhancements to modeling techniques
  Designs and automates reporting templates and dashboards (Domo, Tableau, etc.)
  Evaluates performance of syndicated content available on third party distribution platforms
  Runs simulations and 'what if' analyses keeping in mind the intricacies of big data platforms and their specific run time and capacity planning requirements
  Fulfills ad hoc data analysis requests
 
  Reporting & Predicting
 
  Explains variances, trends, and provides insights to BYU Broadcasting Executives and critical stakeholders for use in strategic planning and specific business performance issues and models and evaluates the potential impact of changes
   
    Identifies and implements data mining protocols as well as manipulates data, identifies visualization and data modeling techniques that will lead to proper translation and presentation of desired information
    Reports on BYU Broadcasting viewership and listenership trends (Nielsen, Adobe, etc.)
    Reports on internal performance related to the content production workflow (Dalet, WideOrbit, etc.)
   
  Models advanced methods of combining charts, maps, timelines and infographics into comprehensible dashboards that both show and predict data
  Creates visualizations of complex relationships and big data sets in a user-friendly and easy-to-understand way to facilitate business decision making (Domo, Tableau, etc.)
  Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to senior leaders and other stakeholders including Church partners
  Collaborates with BYU Athletics and BYU Alumni to combine data and provide insights and reports about the overall effectiveness of strategic marketing and outreach efforts
 
  Product and Personnel Management
 
  Creates and maintain security architecture
  Trains users on reporting tools and dashboards
  Mentors students or other full time employees on how to prepare meaningful reports and templates
 
  Qualifications
  Education/Experience
  Minimum required:
 Bachelor's degree in quantitative field (i.e. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, etc.) AND 2 years of experience in technology, media, or related industry
  Preferred:
 Master's degree in quantitative field (i.e. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, etc.) AND 2 years of experience in technology, media, or related industry
  Skills, abilities, knowledge, licenses, certifications:
  Required:
 
  Experience applying statistical methods to draw insights and support business decisions.
  Proficiency in inferential statistics, hypothesis testing, A/B testing, and confidence intervals.
  Proficiency in Python for data analysis, ETL development, machine learning, and automation, with experience in relevant libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn).
  Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and experience deploying models in production.
  Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-Learn.
  Familiarity with MLOps practices and deployment tools like Docker, Kubernetes, or cloud platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google Cloud AI, or Azure ML).
  Strong SQL skills for data manipulation, aggregation, and complex queries. Familiarity with Amazon RDS (supporting engines like MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle) and hands-on experience in optimizing queries and managing relational databases.
  Expertise in data visualization and building dashboards with tools like Domo, Power BI, or Plotly.
  Understand business objectives and be able to translate objectives into key performance indicators (KPI) and extract meaningful insights by examining trends over time and deliver an executive summary as needed. Well-versed in data analysis and preparation in a fast-paced media technology environment Ability to communicate complex ideas and make data-driven organizational decisions/suggestions
  Ability to work through unfamiliar or unstructured data sources
  Be an effective leader and team member as well as high-level analytical thinker
  Understanding of business and business intelligence, with the business strategy in mind
  Ability to think like an entrepreneur
  Advanced Machine Learning (Deep Learning)
  Knowledge of data warehousing solutions like Amazon Redshift, Snowflake, or other cloud-based warehouses, with an emphasis on building scalable data architectures.
  Familiarity with tools like Amazon RDS (supporting engines like MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc.) and best practices in database management.
  Familiarity in AWS Glue, Apache NiFi, or other ETL frameworks for data pipeline management and transformation.
  Knowledge of data warehousing solutions like Amazon Redshift, Snowflake, or other cloud-based warehouses, with an emphasis on building scalable data architectures.
  Expertise in AWS storage solutions (e.g., S3), database technologies (e.g., DynamoDB, Aurora), and microservices architecture using AWS tools such as ECS, EKS, and Lambda.
  Extensive knowledge of big data tools such as: Hadoop, HBase, Hive, Zookeeper, Spark, R/ Python S3, Dynamo, SQL, Java
 
  Preferred:
 
  Knowledge of similarity search methods (e.g., nearest neighbors, cosine similarity) and approximate nearest neighbors (ANN) algorithms.
  Experience with vector databases such as Pinecone, FAISS, Milvus, or OpenSearch k-NN.
  Experience with data extraction, transformation, and loading processes, including data cleansing and data integration.
  At least one additional programming language: Python, Java, Javascript, Perl, C/C++, etc.
  Risk analysis
  Advanced proficiency in all of the above

descriptionHTML:
Data Scientist


Why work at BYU?

As the flagship higher education institution of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, Brigham Young University (BYU) strives to be among the exceptional universities in the world. At BYU, we are devoted to our faith and to our students. We take an active role in the university's mission: "To assist individuals in their quest for perfection and eternal life."

Our unique mission, deeply rooted in the Gospel of Jesus Christ, provides countless ways to serve and make an impact. This, along with our remarkable culture of belonging, weekly devotionals, and endless opportunities for learning and growth - all situated within a beautiful and historic campus - make it hard to imagine a more inspiring place to work.


Job Summary

BYUtv | BYUradio is looking for a Data Scientist to help us grow our audiences and extend our reach through data-driven decision making. (Check out our world-class content at byutv.org and byuradio.org.)

You will work in a positive, collaborative environment with others who are driven to create amazing work. You will receive many tangible and intangible benefits: Medical, Dental, Life, Long-term Disability, OAD&D, and retirement. For more information, please go to the Benefits website at: https://hrs.byu.edu/employee-benefits Other benefits include tuition, Employee Assistance Program, campus discounts and UTA pass (see website for specifics).

Our Data Scientist will work closely with senior leadership and other stakeholders to create actionable plans for our organization. The Data Scientist will gather, analyze, and manipulate large sets of structured and unstructured data using computer science, statistics, and mathematics (potentially even software engineering) to interpret and then present the results to leadership.

This position is an analytical expert that utilizes skills in both technology and social science to find trends, manage, and predict data. Data will come from a wide variety of sources and will largely be unstructured. This position will work to not only structure the data, but interpret and predict the data to provide clear business solutions and predictions on how the data is moving in efforts to help BYU Broadcasting executives, other campus (e.g. Athletics & Alumni Relations), non-campus, and Church partners and leaders to set clear business strategies for current and future programming.

It is imperative this position have a strong knowledge of business operations, the ability to ingest data, analyze the data and present user-friendly analysis.


Data & Software Development & Preparation

  • Software Engineering / Development
    • Use software development skills to import data from multiple sources into a data warehouse or data lake and other reporting systems for machine learning and human analysis
    • Develops and codes software programs, develops, and enhances complex algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate, and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources
    • Develops and maintains infrastructure systems that connect internal data sets
    • Creates data mining architectures/models/protocols or other data collection frameworks for structured and unstructured ¿big data¿, statistical reporting, and data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets and to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and program enhancement
  • Finds and identifies relevant data sets and sources including Nielsen, Adobe Analytics, Salesforce, etc. that measures performance across viewing audience and audience engagement
    • Interacts with production teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments.
    • Conducts research and explorative analyses to uncover potentially useful data trends which will provide strategic insight into business solutions and with the goal of breaking new ground in data analytics
    • Provides business insights measured against key performance indicators
    • Evaluates and identifies trends in BYUB audience engagement
    • Assesses audience response to Salesforce-driven marketing campaigns
    • Analyzes the effectiveness of promotional activities across social, digital ad placement, TV and Radio platforms (Google, Facebook, etc.)

Data Analysis

  • Applies and integrates statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling and business analysis skills to manage and manipulate complex high-volume data from a variety of sources in order to analyze how BYUtv and BYUradio compare against broader media consumption and audience engagement trends
  • Summarizes business, operations, customer, and economic data in order to develop business intelligence, optimize effectiveness, and predict business outcomes:
    • Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns and prepares ongoing reports and data visualizations (e.g., charts, dashboards, heat maps) in order to inform and guide business decisions made by BYU Broadcasting Executives and stakeholders
    • Analyzes data to help predict business changes in response to micro-economics forces (i.e. cord-cutting, streaming services, viewing habits, etc.)
  • Identifies and documents enhancements to modeling techniques
  • Designs and automates reporting templates and dashboards (Domo, Tableau, etc.)
  • Evaluates performance of syndicated content available on third party distribution platforms
  • Runs simulations and 'what if' analyses keeping in mind the intricacies of big data platforms and their specific run time and capacity planning requirements
  • Fulfills ad hoc data analysis requests

Reporting & Predicting

  • Explains variances, trends, and provides insights to BYU Broadcasting Executives and critical stakeholders for use in strategic planning and specific business performance issues and models and evaluates the potential impact of changes
    • Identifies and implements data mining protocols as well as manipulates data, identifies visualization and data modeling techniques that will lead to proper translation and presentation of desired information
    • Reports on BYU Broadcasting viewership and listenership trends (Nielsen, Adobe, etc.)
    • Reports on internal performance related to the content production workflow (Dalet, WideOrbit, etc.)
  • Models advanced methods of combining charts, maps, timelines and infographics into comprehensible dashboards that both show and predict data
  • Creates visualizations of complex relationships and big data sets in a user-friendly and easy-to-understand way to facilitate business decision making (Domo, Tableau, etc.)
  • Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to senior leaders and other stakeholders including Church partners
  • Collaborates with BYU Athletics and BYU Alumni to combine data and provide insights and reports about the overall effectiveness of strategic marketing and outreach efforts

Product and Personnel Management

  • Creates and maintain security architecture
  • Trains users on reporting tools and dashboards
  • Mentors students or other full time employees on how to prepare meaningful reports and templates

Qualifications

Education/Experience

Minimum required:

Bachelor's degree in quantitative field (i.e. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, etc.) AND 2 years of experience in technology, media, or related industry

Preferred:

Master's degree in quantitative field (i.e. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, etc.) AND 2 years of experience in technology, media, or related industry

Skills, abilities, knowledge, licenses, certifications:

Required:

  • Experience applying statistical methods to draw insights and support business decisions.
  • Proficiency in inferential statistics, hypothesis testing, A/B testing, and confidence intervals.
  • Proficiency in Python for data analysis, ETL development, machine learning, and automation, with experience in relevant libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn).
  • Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and experience deploying models in production.
  • Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-Learn.
  • Familiarity with MLOps practices and deployment tools like Docker, Kubernetes, or cloud platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google Cloud AI, or Azure ML).
  • Strong SQL skills for data manipulation, aggregation, and complex queries. Familiarity with Amazon RDS (supporting engines like MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle) and hands-on experience in optimizing queries and managing relational databases.
  • Expertise in data visualization and building dashboards with tools like Domo, Power BI, or Plotly.
  • Understand business objectives and be able to translate objectives into key performance indicators (KPI) and extract meaningful insights by examining trends over time and deliver an executive summary as needed. Well-versed in data analysis and preparation in a fast-paced media technology environment Ability to communicate complex ideas and make data-driven organizational decisions/suggestions
  • Ability to work through unfamiliar or unstructured data sources
  • Be an effective leader and team member as well as high-level analytical thinker
  • Understanding of business and business intelligence, with the business strategy in mind
  • Ability to think like an entrepreneur
  • Advanced Machine Learning (Deep Learning)
  • Knowledge of data warehousing solutions like Amazon Redshift, Snowflake, or other cloud-based warehouses, with an emphasis on building scalable data architectures.
  • Familiarity with tools like Amazon RDS (supporting engines like MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc.) and best practices in database management.
  • Familiarity in AWS Glue, Apache NiFi, or other ETL frameworks for data pipeline management and transformation.
  • Knowledge of data warehousing solutions like Amazon Redshift, Snowflake, or other cloud-based warehouses, with an emphasis on building scalable data architectures.
  • Expertise in AWS storage solutions (e.g., S3), database technologies (e.g., DynamoDB, Aurora), and microservices architecture using AWS tools such as ECS, EKS, and Lambda.
  • Extensive knowledge of big data tools such as: Hadoop, HBase, Hive, Zookeeper, Spark, R/ Python S3, Dynamo, SQL, Java

Preferred:

  • Knowledge of similarity search methods (e.g., nearest neighbors, cosine similarity) and approximate nearest neighbors (ANN) algorithms.
  • Experience with vector databases such as Pinecone, FAISS, Milvus, or OpenSearch k-NN.
  • Experience with data extraction, transformation, and loading processes, including data cleansing and data integration.
  • At least one additional programming language: Python, Java, Javascript, Perl, C/C++, etc.
  • Risk analysis
  • Advanced proficiency in all of the above


Employee Class: Administrative

Work Location: Provo Campus

Environment: General office or other equivalently good environment

Physical Exam Required: N

Physical Exam Details:

Desired Start Date: As soon as possible

Job Close Date: 11/15/2024

Pay Level: 55T

Approximate Starting Salary: $99,000 - $129,000

Documents Required at time of Application:

Required: Cover Letter, Resume
Optional: Letter of Recommendation 1

Members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints must hold and be worthy to hold a current temple recommend.

Brigham Young University is an equal opportunity employer, including disability and protected veteran status.

Brigham Young University (BYU) is widely recognized not just for its world-class education, but for its deep commitment to inspired religious values. Gathered together in a Christ-centered atmosphere, BYU employees are a vital part of a community of belonging, where we value the experiences, perspectives, and talents of each individual. If you share in our devotion to faith and to excellence, we have a place for you here at BYU!

description:
About Ancestry: When you join Ancestry, you join a human-centered company where every person’s story is important. Ancestry®, the global leader in family history, empowers journeys of personal discovery to enrich lives. With our unparalleled collection of more than 40 billion records, over 3 million subscribers and over 23 million people in our growing DNA network, customers can discover their family story and gain a new level of understanding about their lives. Over the past 40 years, we’ve built trusted relationships with millions of people who have chosen us as the platform for discovering, preserving and sharing the most important information about themselves and their families.  We are committed to our location flexible work approach, allowing you to choose to work in the nearest office, from your home, or a hybrid of both (subject to location restrictions and roles that are required to be in the office- see the full list of eligible US locations HERE). We will continue to hire and promote beyond the boundaries of our office locations, to enable broadened possibilities for employee diversity.  Together, we work every day to foster a work environment that's inclusive as well as diverse, and where our people can be themselves. Every idea and perspective is valued so that our products and services reflect the global and diverse clients we serve.  Ancestry encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants. Passionate about dedicating your work to enriching people’s lives? Join the curious.
 
 As a Staff AI/ML Engineer at AncestryDNA, you will lead a technological transformation that shapes the future of how we use data and machine learning to gain insights from DNA data (no prior experience with DNA required!) Our ideal candidate is a seasoned engineer with deep expertise in AWS services related to big data analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. You will be part of an innovative team dedicated to excellence in a fast-paced and continuously evolving environment, leveraging the planet’s largest genetic database.
 
  What you will do...
 
  Design and implement scalable machine learning models and AI solutions leveraging AWS big data technologies.
  Collaborate with cross-functional teams including ML scientists, computational biologists, and software developers to understand project requirements, and deliver high-impact AI/ML solutions.
  Optimize data processing and machine learning workflows on AWS, focusing on efficiency, security, and responsible AI.
  Drive the adoption of best practices in code, architecture, and processes across the team.
  Provide technical leadership in ML project planning and execution, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
  Mentor junior engineers and data scientists, promoting a culture of learning and innovation.
  Stay updated with the latest developments in AWS services, machine learning, and AI technologies to drive continuous improvement.
  Manage multiple projects simultaneously, adjusting priorities as needed to meet deadlines.
  Be opinionated! You know what works because you’ve done it before, and we want to learn from you.
 
 
  Who you are...
 
  Minimum of 5 years of experience in machine learning, data science, or a related field, with a proven track record of deploying scalable AI/ML solutions.
  Experience with IaC, ideally Terraform.
  Extensive experience with AWS cloud services such as Amazon S3, EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift, SageMaker, and AWS Lambda.
  Proficient in big data technologies and tools like Apache Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka.
  Strong programming skills in Python and/or bring your own coding assistant if you have a different language of choice.
  Experience with ML frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, and Keras.
  Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills.
  Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment.
 
 
  About Us:
 The DNA Science team at AncestryDNA has the privilege of enabling our customers to learn about themselves and their family history through DNA. We are a diverse team, all passionate about discovery, with access to a dataset unlike any other in the world. We drive innovation in our product and we indulge our curiosity. We are customer obsessed. We have a growth mindset. We think big. We know how to achieve big goals through a succession of quick wins, and we also create space for long-term or high-risk endeavors.
 
 Helping people discover their story is at the heart of ours. Ancestry is the largest provider of family history and personal DNA testing, harnessing a powerful combination of information, science and technology to help people discover their family history and stories that were never possible before. Ancestry’s suite of products includes: AncestryDNA, AncestryProGenealogists, Fold3, Newspapers.com, Find a Grave, Archives.com, and Rootsweb. We offer excellent benefits and a competitive compensation package. For additional information, regarding our benefits and career information, please visit our website at http://ancestry.com/careers
 
 As a signatory of the ParityPledge in Support of Women and the ParityPledge in Support of People of Color, Ancestry values pay transparency and pay equity. We are pleased to share the base salary range for this position: $175,800 - $201,000 with eligibility for bonus, equity and comprehensive benefits including health, dental and vision. The actual salary will vary by geographic region and job experience. We will share detailed compensation data for a specific location during the recruiting process. Read more about our benefits HERE.
 
 
   Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085(8-5-20) and sb1162(1-1-23)
 
 #GDSponsored
 #IND2
 #LI-MK1
 #LI-Remote
  Additional Information:
 Ancestry is an Equal Opportunity Employer that makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, citizenship, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition, Ancestry will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.
 
 All job offers are contingent on a background check screen that complies with applicable law. For San Francisco office candidates, pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Ancestry will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
 
 Ancestry is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ancestry via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ancestry. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Ancestry as a result of the referral or through other means.

description:
If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.
 
 
 
  Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.
 
 
  *Location for this role is onsite in Salt Lake City, Utah. Will consider candidates open to relocating*
 
 
 
  The Senior Manager, Research & Analytics is a key leader in the organization, responsible for strengthening WGU’s research and analytics platform, outreach, and impact across our non-degree offerings. This is a key role that will support multiple facets of WGU’s mission, vision, and strategy.
 
 
 
  This leader will support the production of actionable insights (through qualitative research, experimental research, descriptive analytics, and inferential analytics) that will allow WGU to better individualize the student experience to improve key student and staff outcomes. Projects will cover a range of topics including enrollment, marketing, engagement and interventions, curriculum, academic supports, business development, and other administrative and academic processes.
 
 
 
  Successful candidates will have experience in managing a team of research scientists and data analysts with a focus in learning science, behavioral science and education psychology. They will have a desire to collaborate with other institutions and researchers, and to communicate insights to senior WGU leadership and external stakeholders. And they will be strategic in their vision and empathetic in their approach.
 
 
 
  Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
 
 
  
   
    Conduct business and inferential analytics that drive the organization forward in terms of knowledge and impact
   
  
   
    Partner with key stakeholders and leaders to understand their business challenges and opportunities, craft research/analytical solutions, and enable their teams to understand critical performance indicators and trends.
   
  
   
    Delegate work assignments and help ensure proper bandwidth allocation across team members.
   
  
   
    Provide mentorship and support to direct reports (i.e., project prioritization).
   
  
   
    Develop a training and development framework to ensure continual team growth.
   
  
   
    Responsible for the hiring, training, and development of research scientists
   
  
   
    Conduct qualitative and experimental studies to test critical research hypotheses in WGU On-Ramp and Certificate programs, with strong ownership over the full research lifecycle
   
  
   
    Establish processes to manage research projects, and to communicate actionable insights to internal and external stakeholders
   
  
   
    Represent WGU by presenting at relevant conferences.
   
  
   
    Develops and inspires a team of research and analytics professionals to do their best work, and fosters team collaboration and best practices.
   
  
   
    Ensures the timeliness, accuracy, and quality of reports and analysis.
   
  
   
    Provides technical guidance on research designs, analytic methods, and innovative tool sets.
   
  
   
    Fosters an environment that enables cross-functional feedback to team and stakeholders.
   
  
   
    Performs other related duties as assigned.
   
 
 
 
  Knowledge, Skill and Abilities:
 
 
  
   
    Deep knowledge of a field such as learning science, behavioral science, behavioral economics, education psychology, or related field.
   
  
   
    Skilled at managing and prioritizing multiple simultaneous projects, meeting deadlines, and managing stakeholder expectations.
   
  
   
    Proven experience participating in and collaborating with cross-functional teams and personalities successfully.
   
  
   
    Ability to develop and lead a fast-paced, dynamic team.
   
  
   
    Strong analytical skills, including experience with testing design, regression, tracking, and interpreting results.
   
  
   
    Results-oriented, with the ability to deliver results through strong team leadership.
   
  
   
    Expert ability to independently define and conduct original scientific research.
   
  
   
    Data manipulation using programming languages like SQL and Python.
   
  
   
    Data visualization skills using tools like Python and Tableau.
   
  
   
    Deep experience with qualitative and quantitative primary and secondary research methods.
   
  
   
    Proven ability to lead research projects including cost, resource, schedule management, compliance and reporting.
   
  
   
    Excellent written, oral, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
   
  
   
    Exceptional ability to communicate research results and key ideas to lay and scholarly audiences.
   
  
   
    Ability to be a subject matter expert and provide thought leadership in the field.
   
  
   
    Ability to thrive by working collaboratively and creatively in a fast-paced environment.
   
  
   
    Strong attention to detail and exemplifies pride and ownership over the quality of our learning experience.
   
  
   
    Ability to foster strong relationships within the team and external stakeholders
   
  
   
    Ability to build consensus and motivate others.
   
  
   
    Understand customer and market segments and cohorts.
   
  
   
    Ability to think strategically and understand how data helps with problem solving.
   
  
   
    Ability to use data and metrics to critically evaluate assumptions and outcomes.
   
 
 
 
  Competencies:
 
 
  Organizational Impact:
 
 
  
   
    Develops plan to accomplish division or job area responsibilities that align with department.
   
  
   
    Performance may affect department results.
   
  
   
    Work requires some knowledge of the University to recognize impact of decisions made.
   
  
   
    Compiles data to prepare budgets.
   
 
 
 
  Problem Solving and Decision Making:
 
 
  
   
    Responsible for making improvements of processes or systems to enhance performance of the job area.
   
  
   
    Accountable for coordinating activities and maintaining relationships with internal (and occasionally external) parties.
   
  
   
    Assignments received and problems faced are broad and undefined, and require use of analytical concepts, investigation, and knowledge from prior experience.
   
 
 
 
  Communication and Influence:
 
 
  
   
    Communicates within job area and occasionally with external groups and external facing professionals (i.e. Admissions)
   
  
   
    Communicates frequently with external groups on routine and more complex matters.
   
  
   
    Ensures compliance with university policies and procedures within job area and may influence others outside of job area to justify and gain cooperation for policies, practices, and procedures.
   
 
 
 
  Leadership and Talent Management:
 
 
  
   
    Manages a team of professionals. Manages the work of assigned employees and/or supervisors who generally exercise some latitude and independence in their assignments.
   
  
   
    Ensures proper training of team members, and actively participates in hiring, firing, and promotion decisions. Conducts performance reviews and recommends salary reviews.
   
  
   
    Primarily achieves goals through leading a team.
   
 
 
 
  Job Qualifications:
 
 
  Minimum Qualifications:
 
 
  
   
    Master’s in a related field (e.g. Education, Psychology, Learning Science) or analytics discipline (e.g. Data Science; Behavioral Economics, etc.)
   
  
   
    5 years’ experience in related research in the field of education or other human system experimental and quasi-experimental designs and qualitative research
   
  
   
    7 years’ experience in the delivery of data to inform organizational decision making
   
  
   
    Demonstrated abilities in data visualization and data story telling
   
  
   
    2+ years of prior experience managing cross-functional team
   
  
   
    Proven experience with qualitative and quantitative research
   
 
 
 
  Preferred Qualifications:
 
 
  
   
    PhD in a related field (e.g. Education, Psychology, Learning Science) or analytics discipline (e.g. Data Science; Behavioral Economics, etc.)
   
  
   
    Demonstrated experience working with data in the higher education industry and familiarity with the standard KPIs used to measure student success
   
  
   
    Ability to adopt an agile mindset and address business needs with a keen eye towards the individual student and the big picture
   
  
   
    Experience with Salesforce, Tableau, Power BI, Databricks
   
  
   
    Prior experience in educational technology or related field
   
  
   
    Experience with coding languages used to cleanse, transform, and engineer data (SQL, Python, R, Scala, etc.).
   
  
   
    Proficiency with descriptive, inferential, and predictive statistics.
   
 
 
 
  Disclaimer: This Job Description has been designed to indicate the general nature, essential duties, and responsibilities of work performed by employees within this classification. It does not contain a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications that are required of the employee to do this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. This Job Description does not constitute a contract of employment and the University may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.
 
 
  The salary range for this position takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs.
 
 
 
  At WGU, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their position, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is:
  Pay Range: $136,700.00 - $246,000.00
 
 
  How to apply: apply online
 
 
 
  Full-time Regular Positions (FT classification, standard working hours = 40)
 
 
  This is a full-time, regular position that is eligible for bonuses; medical, dental, vision, telehealth and mental healthcare; health savings account and flexible spending account; basic and voluntary life insurance; disability coverage; accident, critical illness and hospital indemnity supplemental coverages; legal and identity theft coverage; retirement savings plan; wellbeing program; discounted WGU tuition; and flexible paid time off for rest and relaxation with no need for accrual, flexible paid sick time with no need for accrual, 11 paid holidays, and other paid leaves, including up to 12 weeks of parental leave.
 
 
   The University is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
descriptionHTML:
If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.
Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.
*Location for this role is onsite in Salt Lake City, Utah. Will consider candidates open to relocating*
The Senior Manager, Research & Analytics is a key leader in the organization, responsible for strengthening WGU’s research and analytics platform, outreach, and impact across our non-degree offerings. This is a key role that will support multiple facets of WGU’s mission, vision, and strategy.
This leader will support the production of actionable insights (through qualitative research, experimental research, descriptive analytics, and inferential analytics) that will allow WGU to better individualize the student experience to improve key student and staff outcomes. Projects will cover a range of topics including enrollment, marketing, engagement and interventions, curriculum, academic supports, business development, and other administrative and academic processes.
Successful candidates will have experience in managing a team of research scientists and data analysts with a focus in learning science, behavioral science and education psychology. They will have a desire to collaborate with other institutions and researchers, and to communicate insights to senior WGU leadership and external stakeholders. And they will be strategic in their vision and empathetic in their approach.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
  • Conduct business and inferential analytics that drive the organization forward in terms of knowledge and impact
  • Partner with key stakeholders and leaders to understand their business challenges and opportunities, craft research/analytical solutions, and enable their teams to understand critical performance indicators and trends.
  • Delegate work assignments and help ensure proper bandwidth allocation across team members.
  • Provide mentorship and support to direct reports (i.e., project prioritization).
  • Develop a training and development framework to ensure continual team growth.
  • Responsible for the hiring, training, and development of research scientists
  • Conduct qualitative and experimental studies to test critical research hypotheses in WGU On-Ramp and Certificate programs, with strong ownership over the full research lifecycle
  • Establish processes to manage research projects, and to communicate actionable insights to internal and external stakeholders
  • Represent WGU by presenting at relevant conferences.
  • Develops and inspires a team of research and analytics professionals to do their best work, and fosters team collaboration and best practices.
  • Ensures the timeliness, accuracy, and quality of reports and analysis.
  • Provides technical guidance on research designs, analytic methods, and innovative tool sets.
  • Fosters an environment that enables cross-functional feedback to team and stakeholders.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skill and Abilities:
  • Deep knowledge of a field such as learning science, behavioral science, behavioral economics, education psychology, or related field.
  • Skilled at managing and prioritizing multiple simultaneous projects, meeting deadlines, and managing stakeholder expectations.
  • Proven experience participating in and collaborating with cross-functional teams and personalities successfully.
  • Ability to develop and lead a fast-paced, dynamic team.
  • Strong analytical skills, including experience with testing design, regression, tracking, and interpreting results.
  • Results-oriented, with the ability to deliver results through strong team leadership.
  • Expert ability to independently define and conduct original scientific research.
  • Data manipulation using programming languages like SQL and Python.
  • Data visualization skills using tools like Python and Tableau.
  • Deep experience with qualitative and quantitative primary and secondary research methods.
  • Proven ability to lead research projects including cost, resource, schedule management, compliance and reporting.
  • Excellent written, oral, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
  • Exceptional ability to communicate research results and key ideas to lay and scholarly audiences.
  • Ability to be a subject matter expert and provide thought leadership in the field.
  • Ability to thrive by working collaboratively and creatively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong attention to detail and exemplifies pride and ownership over the quality of our learning experience.
  • Ability to foster strong relationships within the team and external stakeholders
  • Ability to build consensus and motivate others.
  • Understand customer and market segments and cohorts.
  • Ability to think strategically and understand how data helps with problem solving.
  • Ability to use data and metrics to critically evaluate assumptions and outcomes.
Competencies:
Organizational Impact:
  • Develops plan to accomplish division or job area responsibilities that align with department.
  • Performance may affect department results.
  • Work requires some knowledge of the University to recognize impact of decisions made.
  • Compiles data to prepare budgets.
Problem Solving and Decision Making:
  • Responsible for making improvements of processes or systems to enhance performance of the job area.
  • Accountable for coordinating activities and maintaining relationships with internal (and occasionally external) parties.
  • Assignments received and problems faced are broad and undefined, and require use of analytical concepts, investigation, and knowledge from prior experience.
Communication and Influence:
  • Communicates within job area and occasionally with external groups and external facing professionals (i.e. Admissions)
  • Communicates frequently with external groups on routine and more complex matters.
  • Ensures compliance with university policies and procedures within job area and may influence others outside of job area to justify and gain cooperation for policies, practices, and procedures.
Leadership and Talent Management:
  • Manages a team of professionals. Manages the work of assigned employees and/or supervisors who generally exercise some latitude and independence in their assignments.
  • Ensures proper training of team members, and actively participates in hiring, firing, and promotion decisions. Conducts performance reviews and recommends salary reviews.
  • Primarily achieves goals through leading a team.
Job Qualifications:
Minimum Qualifications:
  • Master’s in a related field (e.g. Education, Psychology, Learning Science) or analytics discipline (e.g. Data Science; Behavioral Economics, etc.)
  • 5 years’ experience in related research in the field of education or other human system experimental and quasi-experimental designs and qualitative research
  • 7 years’ experience in the delivery of data to inform organizational decision making
  • Demonstrated abilities in data visualization and data story telling
  • 2+ years of prior experience managing cross-functional team
  • Proven experience with qualitative and quantitative research
Preferred Qualifications:
  • PhD in a related field (e.g. Education, Psychology, Learning Science) or analytics discipline (e.g. Data Science; Behavioral Economics, etc.)
  • Demonstrated experience working with data in the higher education industry and familiarity with the standard KPIs used to measure student success
  • Ability to adopt an agile mindset and address business needs with a keen eye towards the individual student and the big picture
  • Experience with Salesforce, Tableau, Power BI, Databricks
  • Prior experience in educational technology or related field
  • Experience with coding languages used to cleanse, transform, and engineer data (SQL, Python, R, Scala, etc.).
  • Proficiency with descriptive, inferential, and predictive statistics.
Disclaimer: This Job Description has been designed to indicate the general nature, essential duties, and responsibilities of work performed by employees within this classification. It does not contain a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications that are required of the employee to do this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. This Job Description does not constitute a contract of employment and the University may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.
The salary range for this position takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs.
At WGU, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their position, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is:

Pay Range: $136,700.00 - $246,000.00
How to apply: apply online
Full-time Regular Positions (FT classification, standard working hours = 40)
This is a full-time, regular position that is eligible for bonuses; medical, dental, vision, telehealth and mental healthcare; health savings account and flexible spending account; basic and voluntary life insurance; disability coverage; accident, critical illness and hospital indemnity supplemental coverages; legal and identity theft coverage; retirement savings plan; wellbeing program; discounted WGU tuition; and flexible paid time off for rest and relaxation with no need for accrual, flexible paid sick time with no need for accrual, 11 paid holidays, and other paid leaves, including up to 12 weeks of parental leave.

The University is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

description:
Overview: 
 
  The Data Governance Analyst will embrace the vision of governance and seek to implement that vision within the boundaries of the policies and procedures of the governance program. The Data Governance Analyst will need to be able to help envision future state, current state, and find gaps to help other individuals teams improve data management practices. We are looking for an individual who is adept at building strong relationships with other people while at the same time being an expert on the data governance tools and processes.
  Responsibilities: 
 
   CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
 
 
  Assist with data governance related initiatives. Especially in the realm of Data Quality, Metadata Management (Data Dictionary, Business Glossary, and other: business, technology, and governance asset relationships), and Data Security.
  Provide insightful experience-based consulting to information workers and decision makers related especially to things like Data Quality, Data Security, and Metadata Management.
  Analyze business process and data processes to find areas of improvement. Then help to turn those into viable initiatives, projects, and relationships.
  Train people on the use of the data catalog and governance tool(s).
  Help Identify, recognize & formalize data owners, steward, and custodians within existing responsibilities.
  Assist users with crawling, profiling, lineage maintenance, data quality rules, impact analyses, and linking data assets to business terms.
  Take a special interest in data security, data quality, and metadata management initiatives.
  Act as a representative of the Data Governance Office in meetings and communications. This includes capturing the vision, knowing the details of the direction of our program.
  Help develop training materials and resources for participants in data governance activities.
 
 
 
   CORE SKILLS:
 
 
 
  Excellent verbal and written communication skills; especially in building and maintaining relationships of trust and accountability.
  Demonstrated leadership skills. Creating synergy through service-oriented leadership.
  High degree of understanding and ability to explain both technical and business aspects of information gathering and analysis.
  Be proactive in identifying opportunities. Need to be a self-driven individual that works positively and proactively when tasks are not clear and delineated.
  Be able to identify areas of mutual benefit by analyzing data governance capabilities and aligning them with capabilities of other areas of the business.
  Visioneering. Be able to envision positive outcomes and make those outcomes happen. Ability to share vision with others and get them to capture the vision.
  Seek to understand the perspectives of others, and good at educating non-experts on complex problems and solutions.
  Knowledge and Experience with the US consumer financial services market, regulations, products & services.
  Qualifications: 
 
   REQUIRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:
  
   A total of 8 years of Education and Experience.
   Option 1 : Bachelors in a STEM field + Masters degree in STEM field + 2 Years working experience
   Option 2: Bachelors in a STEM field + 4 Years working experience
   Option 3: 8 Years working experience
   Work Experience includes the following:
  
 
  o At least 2 years of experience performing data management activity such as: Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Database Administration, Data Science, Master Data Management, Data Quality, Business Data Stewardship (formalized), Data Privacy and Compliance, Data Integration and Interoperability, Metadata Management, Reference Data Management. Data management activity may fulfill all years of work experience. o However; For options 2 and 3 - Work experience beyond the minimum 2 years of data management activity may be in one of the following areas: information systems and technology (Networks, Security, Database, Software/Web Development, Technical Support, IT Project Management, etc.), Teaching / Curriculum Development, Training, Technical Writing, Leadership (Manager / Team Leader), Decision making role that generated, enhanced, or consumed data as a major part of the job.
 
   DESIRED EXPERIENCE:
 
 
  
    Experience Working with one or more Data Management tools such as Informatica, Collibra, Alation, Atlan, IBM InfoSphere Data Governance, Talend, Alteryx, Ovaledge, Ataccama ONE, ASG Enterprise Data Intelligence, Claravine, Egnyte, Erwin Data Governance, Precisely Data 360, SAP Master Data Governance, Semarchy xDM, Talend Data Catalog, OneTrust, D&B Connect, Azure Purview, Qlik Catalog, Salesforce Data Studio, Profisee, Claravine, Apache Atlas, Semarchy, Manta Flow, Dataedo and similar platforms. Experience with Collibra is most desired.
   Experience with Ticketing, and Project Management tools such as those offered in the Atlassian stack (Jira and Confluence).
  
 
 
  Experience with Data Management Technologies such as:
 
  o Database Administration (Oracle, MS SQL, MySQL, etc.) & Database Development (SQL),  o Data Warehousing tools (ETL, Snowflake, Oracle Exadata, etc.),  o Business Intelligence Tools (Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Microstrategy, etc.),  o Data Diagramming & Modelling Tools,  o Data Security Tools,  o Data Integration Tools (API middleware, Web hooks, etc.),  o Master Data Management tools and processes.

Experience with Collibra is most desired.
  • Experience with Ticketing, and Project Management tools such as those offered in the Atlassian stack (Jira and Confluence).

o Database Administration (Oracle, MS SQL, MySQL, etc.) & Database Development (SQL),
o Data Warehousing tools (ETL, Snowflake, Oracle Exadata, etc.),
o Business Intelligence Tools (Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Microstrategy, etc.),
o Data Diagramming & Modelling Tools,
